meanings.definition: To do beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always foredo my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to foredo her chores before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel decided to foredo gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His careful planning allowed him to foredo any potential issues.
meanings.sent5: Foredoing your tasks can help you stay organized and efficient.

meanings.sent1: The wise old owl can foredo when it will rain.
meanings.sent2: He tried to foredo the outcome of the game but was surprised by the result.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller claimed to foredo the future with her crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: She could foredo the dangers ahead and warned her friends.
meanings.sent5: Foredoing the weather can help you plan outdoor activities effectively.

meanings.sent1: The long hike foredoed him, and he needed a break.
meanings.sent2: The intense workout session foredoed her muscles, making her sore.
meanings.sent3: The constant barking of the dog foredoed the neighbors' patience.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending tasks foredoed his energy, leaving him tired.
meanings.sent5: Foredoing yourself with too many responsibilities can lead to burnout.
